title: Software Engineer II, ITC
description:
**Who You‚Äôll Work With**
 At Nike, we leverage the power of data and technology to serve athletes\\* around the world. The Data \\& AI (DAI) team is at the forefront of this mission‚Äîbuilding scalable, secure, and intelligent platforms that power decision\\-making and personalized experiences across the Nike ecosystem.
   

  

**Skillset Required**
 WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
   

  

* 3\\+ years of experience in software development, with a strong foundation in distributed systems and data platforms.
* Deep expertise with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
* Hands\\-on experience with Databricks, Snowflake, AWS RDS, Azure SQL, or GCP Cloud SQL, Apache Spark and Apache Airflow.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, JavaScript, Java, Go, or C\\+\\+.
* Strong understanding of Lakehouse architecture, Data Mesh principles, data governance frameworks, and modern data pipelines.
* Proven ability to deliver high\\-impact, API\\-first services at scale.
* Proficiency with tools like Terraform or AWS CloudFormation is critical for managing cloud infrastructure programmatically, ensuring consistency, and enabling automation.
* A strong familiarity and development experiences with agentic workflow and AI/LLM powered enterprise applications
* Frontend Development: Proficiency in modern JavaScript frameworks (Vue.js, React, or Angular) and CSS preprocessors (SCSS/SASS). Experience with component\\-based architecture and responsive design principles.
* Testing \\& Quality Standards: Test\\-driven development (TDD) mindset with hands\\-on experience in pytest, Cypress, or equivalent frameworks. Maintains high test coverage and uses static analysis tools (linters, type checkers) to ensure code quality and maintainability.
* Git Workflow \\& Collaboration: Experience with Trunk\\-Based Development or GitFlow workflows. Comfortable with frequent integration and collaborative branching strategies.
* Agile Delivery: Proven track record working in Scrum or agile teams with iterative, pragmatic, value\\-driven delivery. Ships incremental working software while balancing engineering rigor with timely solutions.
* Business\\-centric Communication: Translates technical investigations into actionable insights for product stakeholders. Articulates the "why" behind technical recommendations in terms of user value, risk mitigation, or business impact. Produces documentation that enables team understanding without requiring follow\\-up spikes.
* Hands\\-on experience with containerization (Docker), CI/CD pipelines, and modern package managers (Poetry, npm/yarn).
* Strong experience with functional programming paradigms. Comfortable writing immutable, composable, side\\-effect\\-free code.
* Strong problem\\-solving and analytical thinking skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with Atomic Design principles for component organization and scalability
* Familiarity with ITCSS (Inverted Triangle CSS) architecture for maintainable stylesheet organization
* Experience with API documentation standards (OpenAPI/Swagger)
* Knowledge of enterprise authentication/authorization (OAuth, OIDC, Okta, or similar SSO platforms)


**What You‚Äôll Work On**
 What You‚Äôll Do
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain scalable data platforms and services.
* Develop SDKs, APIs, and microservices to support enterprise\\-wide data and analytics needs.
* Write clean, maintainable, and well\\-tested code.
* Implement best practices in software development, data governance, and platform observability.
* Collaborate with senior engineers and other team members to design and implement data solutions.
* Ensure data quality and reliability through testing and validation.
* Development of agentic and AI/LLM powered enterprise applications
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to team knowledge sharing.
* Assist in troubleshooting and resolving production issues.

title: Full Stack Programmer
description:
**Own Every Moment at NetApp**
 At NetApp, your ideas power innovation. We lead in intelligent data infrastructure‚Äîdelivering unified storage, integrated data services, and solutions that help organizations unlock the full potential of their data, from AI to multicloud.
   

  

 Ready to innovate and contribute to our path to $10B? Here, you'll collaborate with passionate teams, tackle real\\-world challenges, and see your impact in how customers transform and grow. If you're ready to bring curiosity, creativity, and drive to every moment, NetApp is where your journey begins.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 As a Full Stack Developer, you will be a key player in designing, developing, and deploying end\\-to\\-end features for our commerce applications. You will work across our entire tech stack, from crafting intuitive user interfaces with Angular to building robust backend microservices with Spring Boot. You'll be instrumental in shaping the future of our applications and ensuring its reliability and scalability.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities will include:**
* Designing, building, and maintaining efficient, reusable, and reliable Java code using the Spring Boot framework.
* Developing modern, responsive, and user\\-friendly web frontends using Angular.
* Contributing to our microservices architecture, ensuring high performance and availability of our distributed systems.
* Working with our NoSQL database (MongoDB) to design schemas and manage data effectively.
* Containerizing applications using Docker and managing deployments on Kubernetes.
* Collaborating with cross\\-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and other engineers, to deliver high\\-quality features.
* Writing clean, maintainable code and participating in peer code reviews to ensure code quality.
* Actively participating in architectural discussions and decisions.


 Job Requirements
   

  

**What We're Looking For: Required Skills**
* Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role.
* Strong proficiency in Java and hands\\-on experience with the Spring Boot framework for building microservices.
* Work experience with Angular (Angular 2\\+), TypeScript, HTML5, and CSS3\\.
* Hands\\-on experience with NoSQL databases, specifically MongoDB.
* Good understanding of containerization with Docker and container orchestration with Kubernetes (K8s).
* Experience working with microservices architecture and building/consuming RESTful APIs.
* Proficiency with version control tools, especially Git.
* A problem\\-solving attitude and a passion for learning new technologies.


**Bonus Points: Preferred Skills**
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines
* Hands\\-on experience with Helm charts and Kubernetes management platforms, especially Rancher.
* Familiarity with messaging queues like Kafka


 Education
   

  

 At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in\\-office and/or in\\-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, and any protected classification.
   

  

**Why NetApp?**
 We are all about helping customers turn challenges into business opportunity. It starts with bringing new thinking to age\\-old problems, like how to use data most effectively to run better \\- but also to innovate. We tailor our approach to the customer's unique needs with a combination of fresh thinking and proven approaches.
   

  

 We enable a healthy work\\-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off each year to volunteer with their favourite organizations. We provide comprehensive benefits, including health care, life and accident plans, emotional support resources for you and your family, legal services, and financial savings programs to help you plan for your future. We support professional and personal growth through educational assistance and provide access to various discounts and perks to enhance your overall quality of life.
   

  

 If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.

title: IT Quality Assurance (QA) Trainee
description:
This is a remote position.
   

  

 KraftPixel is a bespoke IT development services company grateful to be working with clients like IIFL, 5Paisa, HDFC Bank Limited, Kapiva and more, carrying a focus on projects in the web domain. We are looking for a high\\-ownership internship candidate with basic working knowledge of web development and automation testing who doesn't need to start from scratch as this is an advanced internship.
   

  

**Your Missions at KraftPixel**
* To assist in the development and execution of test plans for web applications.
* To allow yourself to make mistakes while going all into learning, but not to repeat them more than once.
* To assist in the development and execution of automated test scripts to improve testing efficiency.


 Rest, you can read the JD of this position!
   

  

**Requirements**
**Basic working knowledge (not work experience) of at least 3 of the following:**
 (working knowledge means, if assigned a task you will be able to execute it with help of Google)
   

  

* HTML/CSS
* Java Script
* Bug tracking tools (Jira)
* Automation testing tools
* SEO Testing


 Timings: Monday to Friday \\+ working Saturdays (1st,3rd \\& 5th) 10am to 7pm full\\-time, inclusive of 45 minutes break time.
   

  

**Benefits**
**As a part of this internship:**
* This is a minimum 9 months to a maximum 15 months internship. Your initial stipend will be set to 2\\.5k; your stipend will increase with time between a range of 0 \\- 2\\.5k every 3 months of internship depending on whether you acquire the necessary skillsets as a reward for your dedication. This will increase to a max limit of Rs. 12\\.5k/month.
* Upon completion of 12 months of internship, a full\\-time job offer will be presented to the internship candidates who have performed nothing short of excellent. You have to clock 198 hours compulsorily in a month, so if you are a student with offline college, this internship may not work for you.
* If you are not selected for a full\\-time offer, you will receive a neat\\-looking certificate that will help you in your further career.
* Certificate only if you complete 9 months of internship; and LOR and full\\-time job offer (subject to performance) only upon completion of 12 months of internship.


**Work Timings and Leave Policy**
* Monday to Friday \\+ working Saturdays (1st,3rd \\& 5th) 10:00am to 7:00pm, remote working
* 1 paid leave allowed per month

title: Software Engineer II - React UI / UX
description:
**Job Description**
 You‚Äôre ready to gain the skills and experience needed to grow within your role and advance your career ‚Äî and we have the perfect software engineering opportunity for you.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer II at JPMorgan Chase within the Consumer and community banking technology team Controls Portfolio , you are part of an agile team that works to enhance, design, and deliver the software components of the firm‚Äôs state\\-of\\-the\\-art technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. As an emerging member of a software engineering team, you execute software solutions through the design, development, and technical troubleshooting of multiple components within a technical product, application, or system, while gaining the skills and experience needed to grow within your role.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Executes software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting with ability to think beyond routine or conventional approaches to build solutions or break down technical problems
* Creates secure and high\\-quality production code and maintains algorithms that run synchronously with appropriate systems
* Mentor/coach new joiners in the team and promote a culture of collaboration
* Document‚ÄØdesigns, and any technical decisions made
* Actively participate in‚ÄØstory refinement sessions to ensure tasks, descriptions and acceptance criteria are well defined
* Identify opportunities to eliminate or‚ÄØautomate remediation of recurring issues‚ÄØto improve overall operational stability of software applications and systems
* Contributes to software engineering communities of practice and events that explore new and emerging technologies
* Adds to team culture


**Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills**
* Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 2\\+ years applied experience.
* Develop and maintain user interfaces using React framework.
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers to translate design wireframes and mockups into responsive, interactive features.
* Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs and optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
* Implement best practices for front\\-end architecture and performance optimization.
* Conduct testing and debugging to ensure high\\-quality, error\\-free code.
* Stay up\\-to\\-date with the latest Angular developments and industry trends to propose improvements and innovations.
* Hands\\-on practical experience in application development, testing, and operational stability
* Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages
* Exposure to agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Application Resiliency, and Security
* Emerging knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)


**Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills**
* Prior‚ÄØAWS‚ÄØexperience, with certification in at least one development path
* Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and tools.
* Familiar with Splunk, Dynatrace and other observability tools
* Knowledge on OOPs, Design Principles, Design Patterns and Data Structures . Knowledge in any one RDBMS such as Postgres or Oracle or MySQL
* Knowledge on SpringBoot and Microservices. Knowledge on Observability tools like Dynatrace, Datadog and Splunk

title: Web Developer
description:
**Position: Web Developer** 




**Location: Noida Sec\\-63, Delhi NCR (On\\-site)** 




**Company: The Branding Studio** 




**Employment Type: Full\\-time** 




**Salary: ‚Çπ22,000 \\- ‚Çπ25,000 per month** 




  





 About the Role:
 



 The Branding Studio is looking for a skilled and detail\\-oriented Web Developer with 1‚Äì2 years of experience to join our growing digital team. The ideal candidate should be capable of building, maintaining, and optimising modern, high\\-performing websites while collaborating closely with design, content, and marketing teams to deliver seamless digital experiences for client brands.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 



  




* Develop, maintain, and optimise responsive websites and landing pages for client projects.
* Convert UI/UX designs into clean, functional, and scalable web interfaces.
* Ensure websites are fast, SEO\\-friendly, mobile\\-responsive, and cross\\-browser compatible.
* Work with CMS platforms (WordPress, Shopify, Webflow, etc.) for website development and updates.
* Collaborate with designers, SEO, and performance marketing teams to implement best practices.
* Debug, troubleshoot, and resolve website issues related to performance, functionality, and security.
* Implement basic on\\-page SEO, tracking codes, and third\\-party integrations.
* Stay updated with the latest web technologies, frameworks, and development trends.Stay updated with the latest web technologies, frameworks, and development trends.



  





 Requirements:
 


* 1‚Äì2 years of hands\\-on experience in web development (agency experience preferred).
* Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frontend practices.
* Experience with CMS platforms like WordPress, Shopify, or Webflow.
* Basic understanding of UI/UX principles and responsive design.
* Familiarity with SEO best practices and website performance optimisation.
* Ability to work on multiple projects and meet deadlines.
* Strong problem\\-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
* Bonus: Experience with React, Next.js, or backend integrations is a plus.



  





 Benefits:
 



  




* Opportunity to work with a fast\\-growing creative and performance marketing agency.
* Exposure to websites across multiple industries and business models.
* Collaborative, learning\\-focused work environment.
* Strong growth opportunities in web development, optimisation, and architecture.
* Chance to work closely with designers, marketers, and strategists on end\\-to\\-end projects.

title: Full-Stack Intern
description:

title: System Engineer
description:
**About the Role** 

 Our client is seeking a
 **System Engineer (Solutions Engineering)** 
 who will play a critical role across the sales lifecycle and post\\-sale implementation. This position blends technical expertise with strong customer\\-facing skills, working closely with sales, product, and engineering teams to design, implement, and optimize video\\-based solutions for customers.
 



 The ideal candidate will have hands\\-on experience with video technologies and the ability to translate complex technical workflows into clear business value for both technical and non\\-technical stakeholders.
 



  





  




**Key Roles \\& Responsibilities** 
**Technical Sales \\& Pre\\-Sales** 
* Partner with Account Executives to deliver technical presentations, workshops, and product demonstrations.
* Clearly articulate solution value with a focus on
 **video monetization, live streaming, and video hosting** 
 use cases.
* Support the sales cycle by addressing technical queries, architecture discussions, and proof\\-of\\-concept requirements.


**Solution Design \\& Workflow Validation** 
* Understand client requirements and business objectives to design customized video workflows.
* Validate technical feasibility and document end\\-to\\-end solution architectures.
* Recommend best practices for scalability, performance, and reliability.


**Implementation \\& Integration** 
* Lead technical onboarding and post\\-sale implementation for new customers.
* Integrate APIs, SDKs, and platforms into client applications across
 **web, mobile, and OTT environments** 
 .
* Ensure smooth handover from sales to implementation and ongoing success teams.


**Technical Problem Solving** 
* Act as the primary technical point of contact for customers during onboarding and beyond.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues such as
 **streaming latency, playback failures, and encoding errors** 
 .
* Collaborate closely with internal product and engineering teams to drive resolutions.


**Subject Matter Expertise** 
* Maintain deep knowledge of video technologies and evolving industry trends, including
 **live streaming, AI\\-driven video features, and monetization models** 
 .
* Stay informed about competitive offerings and market developments to strengthen solution positioning.



  





  




**Required Technical Skills** 
* Strong understanding of
 **video hosting, streaming workflows, and media delivery pipelines** 
 .
* Working knowledge of networking fundamentals relevant to video delivery.
* Experience with APIs, SDKs, and system integrations.
* Ability to diagnose and resolve media\\-related performance and quality issues.



  





  




**Preferred Qualifications** 
* **Experience:** 
 3‚Äì6\\+ years in a SaaS environment as a Sales Engineer, Solutions Consultant, or Solutions Architect.
* **Education:** 
 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
* **Communication:** 
 Excellent ability to explain complex video and system concepts to non\\-technical stakeholders.
* Strong documentation and presentation skills.



  





  




**Why This Role** 
* High\\-impact, customer\\-facing role at the intersection of sales and engineering.
* Exposure to cutting\\-edge video technologies and large\\-scale implementations.
* Opportunity to influence solution design, customer success, and product feedback.

title: Software Engineer II Python, AWS, LLM‚Äôs, Agentic AI
description:
**Job Description**
 You‚Äôre ready to gain the skills and experience needed to grow within your role and advance your career ‚Äî and we have the perfect software engineering opportunity for you.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer II at JPMorgan Chase within CCB Fin, you will be part of an agile team that enhances, designs, and delivers software components for the firm‚Äôs state\\-of\\-the\\-art technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in Python, large language models (LLMs), agentic systems, and full stack development to build innovative solutions and drive the adoption of advanced AI technologies.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable software solutions using Python and modern full stack technologies.
* Build and integrate large language models (LLMs) and AI/ML components to enhance product functionality and user experience.
* Architect and implement agentic systems and autonomous workflows to drive intelligent automation within applications.
* Develop robust front\\-end interfaces using Angular, ensuring responsive and intuitive user experiences.
* Create and maintain secure, efficient back\\-end services and APIs.
* Leverage cloud platforms (such as AWS, Azure, or GCP) for application deployment, scalability, and reliability.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to deliver high\\-quality technology solutions in an agile environment.
* Participate in code reviews, troubleshooting, and optimization of software components.
* Ensure best practices in software engineering, including security, stability, and performance.
* Stay current with emerging technologies in AI, cloud, and full stack development to continuously improve team capabilities.


**Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills**
* Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 2\\+ years applied experience
* Hands\\-on practical experience in system design, application development, testing, and operational stability
* Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages
* Hands\\-on experience designing and implementing agentic systems or autonomous workflows
* Demonstrable ability to code in one or more languages
* Experience across the whole Software Development Life Cycle
* Exposure to agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Application Resiliency, and Security
* Emerging knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)


**Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills**
* Familiarity with modern front\\-end technologies, Databricks
* Familiarity with containerization (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes)


**ABOUT US**

title: Engineer, AS
description:
**This job is with Deutsche Bank, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ\\+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.** 
**Position Overview**
**Role Description**
 We are seeking a detail\\-oriented and experienced Software QA Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our software through rigorous testing and validation processes. You will work closely with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to identify and resolve issues, ensuring our software meets the highest standards. You will define and execute manual and automated tests on our application with a focus on delivering robust solutions to meet business needs.
   

  

**What We‚Äôll Offer You**
 As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that you‚Äôll enjoy
   

  

* Best in class leave policy.
* Gender neutral parental leaves
* 100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral)
* Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members
* Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents
* Accident and Term life Insurance
* Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above


**Your Key Responsibilities**
* Develop, implement, and maintain test plans, test cases and test scripts.
* Execute manual and automated tests to identify software defects and ensure product quality.
* Collaborate with development teams to understand requirements and design effective test strategies.
* Report and track defects providing detailed documentation and analysis.
* Perform regression testing to ensure existing functionality is not compromised by new changes.
* Ensure SDLC policies in regards of testing are fulfilled
* Continuously improve testing processes and tools to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.


**Your Skills And Experience**
* Strong Trade Finance Domain knowledge
* Minimum of 4\\-8 years of experience in software quality assurance
* Proficiency in software testing methodologies and tools
* Ability to write clear and concise test documentation
* Strong attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
* Should be good at problem solving, prioritization and debugging with excellent analytical skills
* Strong understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies.
* Experience with automated testing frameworks and scripting languages.
* Strong proficiency in Python and experience with automation frameworks like Serenity BDD Cucumber, Gatling etc.
* Hands\\-on experience with version control systems (e.g., Git), CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins), and build tools (e.g. Gradle).
* Experience in testing RESTful APIs and web services.
* Knowledge of BDD/TDD methodologies and tools like Cucumber
* Knowledge of database management and SQL for data validation.
* Good knowledge with UNIX commands
* Articulate issues and risks to management in timely manner
* Work alongside various project stakeholders to ensure that specific streams of work are progressing, provide guidance by example and act as an escalation point for the QA \\& Testing Senior Analysts
* Capability to collate metrics and KPI information for reporting purposes
* Effective communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Willingness to learn \\& adapt new technologies like GCP


**How We‚Äôll Support You**
* Training and development to help you excel in your career
* Coaching and support from experts in your team
* A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
* A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs


**About Us And Our Teams**
 Please visit our company website for further information:
   

  

**https://www.db.com/company/company.html**
 We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.
   

  

 Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.
   

  

 We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

title: Lead Software Engineer - Java, Spring, Multithreading, Oracle
description:
**Job Description**
 We have an opportunity to impact your career and provide an adventure where you can push the limits of what's possible.
   

  

 As a Lead Software Engineer at JPMorgan Chase within the Commercial \\& Investment Bank's Equities Technology team , you are an integral part of an agile team that works to enhance, build, and deliver trusted market\\-leading technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. As a core technical contributor, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and supporting technology solutions for a high\\-profile fast\\-growing business area within the Prime Finance Services group. You will collaborate with global teams and business partners to deliver scalable, efficient, and innovative solutions that drive the firm‚Äôs strategic objectives.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
